text: Xhosa is one of the official languages of South Africa. Xhosa is spoken by 7.6 million people, or about 18% of the South African population. Xhosa is written using a Latin alphabet. Henry Hare Dugmore helped translate the entire Bible in Xhosa language. Xhosa has ten vowels. Xhosa is well known for its set of three major clicks. ==References== Category:Languages of South Africa Category:Bantu languages Category:Languages of Zimbabwe Category:Languages of Lesotho
title: Xhosa language
